> From: Aditya Yadav [mailto:yadava@...]
>
> I'm serialising a class and sending it over a socket to another
> machine which does not have the classes of the agent. So I'm
> making two trips, first I'm transferring the jar file containing
> the classes and I'm using
> Class.forname("agentclass",true,customjarclassloader) to load the classes.
> Then in the next connection I'm transferring the serialised class
> object to the host. But on reaching the host it gives a
> ClassNotFoundError when I'm trying to deserialise the object.

So, just to be clear, you are actually serializing an object, not the Class
that the object is an instance of, or is it an instance of the
java.lang.Class object?  Sorry -- in these kinds of problems it doesn't hurt
to be very precise.  Is the class of the serialized object one of the
classes contained in the previously transmitted jar file?

> What should I do? And how can I implement this serialised object
> transfer dynamically without first installing the classes on the
> other host.

Why not use RMI?  Or a dynamic proxy?

Scott Stirling
